entry.title: Create Absence Page
entry.content:
Hi experts,

Is it possible to create custom screen for Create Absence? I created default screen and assigned it to object "Employee Time", but it is not reflected on Create Absence /Request Time Off UI (Quick action or Workbench), it is visible in Workflow page only.

I would need to modify the "Create absence". Custom fields added in Object definition are visible but I need to change the appearance of the screen and add business rules, like in workflow page.

Can you please advise?

Thank you in advance

Gosia

entry.title: ESS permission for document generation template does not show template in RBP
entry.content:
1) Manage permission group->ESS role

2) Manage document generation template-> de-select all-> specific template is not available in dropdown

entry.title: Unable to Edit a Custom Field under one-time payments
entry.content:
Hello!

We have a requirement to create a custom field under One-Time Payments. The field’s visibility is set to "Edit" in the Business Configuration UI. We’ve also assigned an onChange business rule that should make the field editable only when a specific pay component is selected.

To verify the rule behavior, we enabled rule trace, which confirms that the condition is working correctly. When the correct pay component is selected, the rule sets the field’s visibility to "both". The trace shows:

Set property 'payComponentNonRecurringModel.payComponentNonRecurring_custom_string1.visibility' to value 'both' in modified object 'custom-string1'

However, in the UI, the field custom-string1 is not editable. It only appears under the “View Empty Fields” section on the right panel, and not in the main editable area.

We recently enabled the latest People Profile, and we’re wondering if there’s an additional configuration step required to make the field editable and visible in the main UI.

Any inputs are greatly appreciated.

-Swathi

entry.title: Automatic update of custom MDF object data
entry.content:
Hi,

does anyone of you have any experience with updating data in the custom MDF object via Integration Center?

We have the object to calculate data for Loyalty Agreements. All calculations e.g. the monthly cost, amount to be paid etc. are setup as Save Rules in the object definition. 

We would like to have that data updated automatically every day.

Currently, we need to go to each employee, select Loyalty Agreement and save it to recalculate the fields. 

Do you have any idea how it can be resolved?

Thank you in advance!

Aneta

SAP SuccessFactors Employee Central

entry.title: Compound Employee API Query
entry.content:
Hi Experts,

I have a requirement to fetch data from SF Employee compound API based on conditions like last_modified_on >= last run date or employment start date = today or employment end date = today.
Since OR operation is not supported, I tried to call these 3 queries separately, first using condition of last modified date, then employment_end_date and start date (this is a general one as I am not able to do nested query). Then merge all of these together and filter them. But employment_end_date query is giving complete data in the response along with the requested data,if present.
What is the best way to achieve this scenario.
Thanks & Regards,
Keerthana

entry.title: No EP user in Integration Center Job Output
entry.content:
Hello Experts,

We are using EmpEmployment entity in Integration Center Job (no filter is used) to extract data .It has come to our attention that contractors are not being included in the output of the IC job.

For contractors, only basic user import is performed, and no other data is available for contractors. Kindly clarify whether it is anticipated behavior to omit contractors from this job's output, and if so, could you please explain the rationale behind this?

 

Best Regards.

entry.title: Including multiple Matrix Managers in Performance– “User Does Not Exist” Error Despite Valid USERIDs
entry.content:
Hi all,

Similar to @Maria851  in https://community.sap.com/t5/technology-q-a/successfactors-create-job-to-run-importing-matrix-and-custom-managers/qaq-p/14136823 and @SatishPanda  in https://community.sap.com/t5/human-capital-management-q-a/can-we-assign-two-matrix-manager-to-a-single-employee-in-system/qaq-p/13639437 

We are trying to import matrix managers using the Import Matrix Manager and Custom Manager Relationships tool in SAP SuccessFactors. The process followed is from documentation https://help.sap.com/docs/successfactors-platform/managing-user-information and using the CSV format with following structure:

USERID,MGR_USERID,RELATIONSHIP,ORG_CHART_DISPLAY,ACTION
1111,2222|3333,EX,TRUE,ADD

Both 1111, 2222and 3333are confirmed as active users in the UDF and visible in the platform. However, I consistently receive this error:

Line number: 1 | Column: MGR_USERID | Cause: The user does not exist in the system.

 

We’ve already:

  • Verified that the USERIDs are active and correctly formatted
  • Ensured the file is UTF-8 encoded
  • Cleaned up any hidden characters or line breaks

Still no success.

Has anyone encountered this before? Could this be related to how the platform validates USERIDs in this tool vs. the UDF? Any insights or workarounds would be greatly appreciated.

Thanks in advance!

Documentation reviewed:

https://help.sap.com/docs/successfactors-platform/managing-user-information/importing-matrix-and-custom-managers

https://help.sap.com/docs/successfactors-ec-s4-hcm-integration/implementing-data-migration-and-replication-to-employee-central/how-manager-s-user-id-is-updated

3247460 - Matrix manager and HR manager are unable to sync to

From <https://me.sap.com/notes/3247460/E>

2087507 - Data Imports & Exports: Matrix Manager and Custom Manager Import - Displaying Matrix & Custom Manager

From <https://me.sap.com/notes/2087507/E>

entry.title: Primary flag handling for email and phone information
entry.content:
Hi everyone,

During the recruiting process, we first collect private contact information, which has to be set as the primary contact in the system. Later, once the business contact information are created (such as the business email and phone), we want to make those the new primary contact.

However, updating the primary contact via API or import is not possible unless we also modify the original (private) contact record. It would be much more effective to derive it dynamically or allow a conditional logic—for example: if only one phone type exists, set it as primary, or: if two phone types exist, use "business" as primary.

We’re genuinely surprised this isn’t a more widely reported issue. It causes significant challenges when integrating contact data across Recruiting, SuccessFactors, and external systems like Identity Management. In our case, business contact details come from HCM, but since the private contact information from Recruiting must be set as primary (because no other types exist yet), we cannot update the business info without also updating the existing information—because only one record can be marked as primary at a time.

If you are facing similar problems, we’ve submitted an improvement request to make the field handling more flexible.

We’d really appreciate it if you could check it out and leave a vote if it affects you too.
Thanks a lot!

Julia

entry.title: SFSF – Onboarding – How to Make at Least One Document Mandatory in Work Pe
entry.content:
Hi Experts,

I need to configure a business rule in SuccessFactors Onboarding to ensure that the onboardee is required to submit at least one specific document type under the Work Permit section.

In the picklist for document types, we have five different options. However, we want to make it mandatory for the onboardee to provide at least one of the following: Passport or ID Card.

How can this be implemented using a business rule?

Thanks. 

Kind Regards,

Erika

entry.title: Best Practices Employee Central Core Setup Failing with SDM Parsing Error
entry.content:
Dear SAP SuccessFactors Community,

I currently attempting to implement the Best Practices Employee Central Core Setup via the Upgrade Center. Unfortunately, the job fails with the following error:

Exception occurred while executing class BestPracticesModifySDMWithXMLParser
Exception: BPMsg – Failed to update Succession Data Model.
Reason: Failed to parse data model.
Cleanup initiated before reading the config file.
Final result: False
Upgrade Duration: 6,252 seconds
Outcome: Upgrade Failed – All changes rolled back

📝Notes & Pre-checks Performed:

  1. All picklists are valid and verified in Picklist Center
  2. MDF cache has been cleared from Provisioning
  3. SDM and CSF alignment has been reviewed—for the "fte" element
  4. Deprecated or conflicting blocks removed from the SDM

🔴<hris-element id="directDeposit"/>
🔴<hris-action id="planLeaveOfAbsenceAction"/>
🔴<hris-action id="returnLeaveOfAbsenceAction"/> is removed from the SDM

I've attached both the Succession Data Model (SDM) and Country-Specific SDM (CSF-SDM). Kindly review them and let me know your feedback

⌛The process ran for over an hour before failing

Request for Support❓

Has anyone encountered this issue or have insights into successfully parsing the SDM during this upgrade? Any guidance or workaround to complete the Best Practices setup smoothly would be greatly appreciated.

Thank you in advance 
@SAPSuccessFactors @AllMembers

entry.title: Send email notification when an existing Termination date changes
entry.content:
We already have an email notification which is sent to a specific group of people via an email address when an employee (who meets specific criteria) is terminated.   This is already working perfectly.   However, we now want to create a separate email notification, which is sent to the same group of people if the Termination Date changes.

For example, Fred Bloggs has been terminated with an effective date in the future of, say 15 August 2025.   A notification is sent to a specific group of people to let them know of the forthcoming termination action.   However, that Termination Date might be brought forward or pushed out to a different date, say 30 August 2025.   When the Termination Date is changed, we want an additional email notification to be sent to the same group of people to let them know there's been a Termination Date change.   The email itself would simply provide the latest Termination Date for that employee, so nothing complex like previous Termination Date and current Termination Date.

I've attempted this numerous times, but the rule created to trigger the workflow (email notification) doesn't trigger.   Has anyone else done this successfully and if so, how did you achieve it?  Some other notable points:

Our Termination Date is configured as part of our employmentInfo HRIS element.   But when we change the Termination Date we essentially Edit the event date which relates to the Termination event directly from within Job Info History.  We then go into the Employment Details portlet (which is NOT effective-dated) and adjust the Payroll End Date and Last Date Worked dates accordingly.

entry.title: SAP SUCCESSFACTORS BUG REPORT
entry.content:
Dear SAP Community, please find the Details of bug highlighted below. Let me know if you have a Fix!

Details of the BUG:

This Bug has been identified in Change Job and Compensation Information for...  Transaction which only selects the Job information and not the Compensation Information. Ideally, this should also select Job and Compensation Information which is the core purpose of the transaction. But the following transaction only selects the Job information and not the Compensation Information.

 

There are separate transactions Change Job Information for... and Change Compensation for... transactions which are used for changing Job Information and compensation information separately.
